title: Add PowerPoint to PDF conversion feature

requirements.summary: Create PowerPointToPdfPage component with drag-and-drop file upload for .ppt/.pptx files
acceptanceCriteria: Page accepts .ppt and .pptx file types for upload
Drag-and-drop file zone validates PowerPoint file types
Conversion progress tracking displays during processing
Successful conversion allows user to download the resulting PDF
Page requires authentication before allowing conversion
AdSense ad placements match the pattern used in other conversion pages

file_operations.description: Create a new page component for PowerPoint to PDF conversion. Follow the exact structure and patterns from ExcelToPdfPage.tsx and WordToPdfPage.tsx: include useInternetIdentity hook for authentication check, DragAndDropFileZone with accept prop for .ppt and .pptx files, state management for file upload/conversion progress, handleConvert function calling the powerPointToPdf utility, AdSenseHeader and AdSenseInContent components for ad placements, and internationalization using useI18n. Display conversion progress with percentage, show download button on success, and handle errors with toast notifications.

requirements.summary: Create powerPointToPdf utility function for converting PowerPoint files to PDF
acceptanceCriteria: Function accepts PowerPoint file blobs as input
Function validates file type is .ppt or .pptx
Function provides progress callback for UI updates
Function returns a PDF blob on successful conversion
Function throws descriptive errors for invalid inputs or conversion failures

file_operations.description: Create a utility function matching the structure of excelToPdf.ts and wordToPdf.ts. Accept parameters: file (File), onProgress callback (optional). Validate file type is .ppt or .pptx using file.name.endsWith checks. Include progress tracking callbacks at key conversion steps (0%, 50%, 100%). Since PowerPoint conversion requires server-side processing like Word documents, throw a descriptive error indicating that PowerPoint to PDF conversion requires backend processing and is not yet fully implemented. Return Promise<Blob> type signature. Include comprehensive error handling with user-friendly error messages.

requirements.summary: Add PowerPoint to PDF card to ConvertIntoPdfPage grid
acceptanceCriteria: Card displays appropriate icon and title for PowerPoint to PDF
Card links to /tools/powerpoint-to-pdf route
Card styling matches existing Word and Excel conversion cards
Card is positioned logically in the grid layout

file_operations.description: Add a new card entry to the conversion tools grid after the Excel to PDF card. Use t('tools.powerPointToPdf.title') for the title, t('tools.powerPointToPdf.description') for the description text. Set the link to='/tools/powerpoint-to-pdf'. Use an appropriate icon (FilePresentation from lucide-react or similar presentation-related icon). Match the Card component structure with CardHeader, CardTitle, CardDescription, and hover effects identical to the existing Word and Excel cards. Position the card in the grid between Excel and Image conversion options.

requirements.summary: Add /tools/powerpoint-to-pdf route to App.tsx router configuration
acceptanceCriteria: Route /tools/powerpoint-to-pdf is registered in the router configuration
Route lazy-loads the PowerPointToPdfPage component
Route follows the same authentication and layout patterns as other tool pages

file_operations.description: Add a new route entry in the createBrowserRouter configuration for path '/tools/powerpoint-to-pdf'. Use lazy loading with React.lazy(() => import('./pages/PowerPointToPdfPage')). Position this route after the /tools/excel-to-pdf route and before /tools/image-to-pdf route in the tools section. Ensure it follows the same authentication check pattern and layout wrapper as other conversion tool routes.

requirements.summary: Add internationalization keys for PowerPoint to PDF feature in English and Spanish
acceptanceCriteria: English translations added for all PowerPoint to PDF UI text
Spanish translations added for all PowerPoint to PDF UI text
Translation keys follow the established naming convention (e.g., tools.powerPointToPdf.*)
All user-facing text in PowerPointToPdfPage uses i18n hooks

file_operations.description: Add a new 'powerPointToPdf' section under 'tools' in both 'en' and 'es' translation objects. Include keys for: title (e.g., 'PowerPoint to PDF'), description (short feature description), uploadInstruction (drag-and-drop instructions), selectFile (button text), convert (convert button), converting (progress text), success (success message), download (download button), errors.invalidFile, errors.conversionFailed, errors.notImplemented. Follow the exact naming pattern used for excelToPdf and wordToPdf sections. Ensure Spanish translations are accurate and natural.

requirements.summary: Add PowerPoint to PDF link to HomePage tool grid
acceptanceCriteria: Link card appears on the homepage tool grid
Card includes PowerPoint-related icon
Card description clearly indicates PowerPoint to PDF conversion
Card navigates to /tools/powerpoint-to-pdf when clicked

file_operations.description: Add a new card to the tool grid section in HomePage. Position it logically after the Excel to PDF card and before the Image to PDF card. Use FilePresentation icon from lucide-react or similar. Set the link to='/tools/powerpoint-to-pdf'. Use t('tools.powerPointToPdf.title') for the card title and t('tools.powerPointToPdf.description') for the description text. Match the Card component structure, styling, and hover effects of existing tool cards. Ensure the card follows the same responsive grid layout pattern.
